author: bridge-bot
content:
<realbigsean> There’s some discussion around this here:

https://github.com/ethereum/consensus-specs/pull/3141

And another pr related:

https://github.com/ethereum/consensus-specs/pull/3169

You should still make the is data availability check, but if you’ve made the check already, it doesn’t expire. This means you won’t be able to sync from genesis in the scenario where the chain hasn’t finalized in more than` MIN_EPOCHS_FOR_BLOBS_SIDECARS_REQUESTS `so the way to recover would be to weak subjectivity sync from somewhere within the data availability period and consider all blocks in this chain available

author: __kasey__
content:
Thanks for the extra context. My concern is exactly the same as dapplion, syncing from genesis. Same would apply to backfilled blocks in a checkpoint synced node. However I just realized that this line in `on_block`  already precluded processing older finalized blocks in the manner specified by on_block in previous versions of the spec:
```
finalized_slot = compute_start_slot_at_epoch(store.finalized_checkpoint.epoch)
assert block.slot > finalized_slot
```
So I guess genesis sync and backfill are already left as an exercise for the reader (which explains why your comment assumes this is only an issue for periods of non-finality > `MIN_EPOCHS_FOR_BLOBS_SIDECARS_REQUESTS`).

author: __kasey__
content: actually only a non-issue for backfill. Sync from genesis would still be an issue.
